thread.title: Gas leak and small fire at rail yard cause commuter rail delays - News
thread.title_full: Gas leak and small fire at rail yard cause commuter rail delays - News

author: boston.com
title: Gas leak and small fire at rail yard cause commuter rail delays - News
text:
A National Grid gas leak and fire at a rail yard have caused delays on the MBTA’s commuter rail.
Greenbush and Old Colony line passengers should take the Red Line to Braintree where trains are waiting, Mac Daniel, a spokesperson for Keolis, said.
Greenbush, Middle/Lake and King/Ply trains are staging at Braintree. When trains are full they will depart and make all local stops outbound
— MBTA Commuter Rail (@MBTA_CR) October 21, 2015 Daniel said only one track was open near the scene of the leak and small fire. Follow the MBTA Commuter Rail’s Twitter account for updates below.
Tweets by @MBTA_CR
